questionsData.title: "alkali" means "the ashes of a plant".
The particles of food in the freezer get closer.
"Hertz" is used to measure light waves.
"calm down" means "stop being excited".
A mule is a cross between a donkey and a horse.
A hill is higher than a mountain.
"peak" is the highest part of a mountain.
A nightmare is often brilliant.
A very large wood is called flood.
"homeless" means "having new home".
To work with tools is to work with bare hands.
When you ask for advice, you say "Can you help me, please?".
A furniture maker is someone who plants farms.
"homes" and "houses" are synonyms.
You greet someone when you meet or write to him.
"to fry" is "to put things in hot oil".
Eskimos are people who live in the deserts.
"to harvest" is "to take from trees".
"stained" and "mutinied" are synonyms.
There is no sand on the beach.
The text is mainly talking about ……
questionsData.article:
The Black Death was a plague that killed many people. It first showed up in Europe in October 1347. Plague
was one of the most deadly diseases. It was a disease that came from rodents and fleas, but it spread (quickly 1)
among people who were in contact with the infected person. It spread quickly from person to person even if
people were healthy. Some towns shut themselves down and sealed their gates, so no one could come in or out.
The authorities didn't know what to do with the dead bodies, so (they 2) just piled them up in carts and let them
(lying 3) there. They told people to stay at home and not to talk to anyone since they might get sick. It was said
that the disease came on a ship from Asia. It had people on board too, but also rats. The rats carried the Black
Death with them. The bacterium responsible for the Black Death is called Yersinia Pestis. Other animals that
could carry the plague were cats and dogs

questionsData.title: The ……. responsible for the Black Death is Yersinia Pestis.
